page.title: 09FISH PROCESSING AT L'MOUTH.
page.content: The local Fish Processing Plant is situated in the Harbour area of Lossiemouth.This business has been in operation,in its present form,for two years and employs 30 people,mostly women.The firm buy their raw material at the local fish market.This consists of 50 stone of prawns bought daily. The skilled workers shell the prawns with amazing speed.The prawns are then washed thoroughly,before being loaded into a frosting machine and left there for two hours.They are next passed through a machine which coats them in breadcrumbs.A conveyor belt delivers the prawns to the packaging room. Here they are put in trays and labelled ready to be uplifted by refrigerated lorries which transport them to their markets.
